result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex J. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Granted release privileges under 303.08(1), including for counseling and childcare.

Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall obtain all prescriptions from 1 pharmacy and report new or changing prescriptions to Agent within 72 hours.
Credit for 3 days, if probation is revoked.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant may serve in any county where arrangements can be made.
Sentence to commence within 60 days.
